commitResults.messageTitle: Level-0: Rename chatbot to Buddy, implement greet and exit
Level-2: Add task storage and listing
Level-4: Add Todo, Deadline, and Event task types
A-TextUiTesting: Add automated text UI testing
A-Enums: Use enum for task types
Update test files to include all implemented features
Level-7: Add save and load functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add automatic saving of tasks to ./data/buddy.txt
- Load tasks from file on startup
- Handle missing data folder and file
- Support all task types (Todo, Deadline, Event)
- Preserve task completion status
- Save after every task list modification
Implement Level-7: Save and load tasks functionality

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-8: Add date and time parsing functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add LocalDate support for deadline dates
- Parse yyyy-mm-dd format dates
- Format dates as MMM d yyyy for display
- Maintain backward compatibility with text dates
- Store original date strings for persistence
Implement Level-8: Date and time parsing functionality

commitResults.messageTitle: A-Packages: Organize classes into buddy package
commitResults.messageBody:
- Move all Java classes to buddy package
- Add package buddy; declaration to all classes
- Maintain src/main/java as source root
- All functionality remains intact
Add Gradle build automation support

- Merge add-gradle-support branch from upstream
- Configure mainClass to buddy.Buddy
- Configure shadowJar archiveBaseName to buddy
- Gradle build, run, and test tasks working

commitResults.messageTitle: A-JUnit: Add JUnit tests for TaskList and Parser
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add TaskListTest with tests for addTask, deleteTask, and markTask
- Add ParserTest with tests for parseCommand, parseDeadline, parseTaskNumber
- Test both valid inputs and exception cases
- All tests pass with Gradle test runner

- Generated buddy.jar using Gradle shadowJar task
- JAR file can be run with: java -jar buddy.jar
- All functionality works correctly in JAR form

- Add find command to search tasks by keyword
- Implement case-insensitive substring matching
- Add findTasks method to TaskList class
- Add showFoundTasks method to Ui class
- Display matching tasks with numbering

commitResults.messageTitle: A-JavaDoc: Add JavaDoc comments to main classes
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add class-level JavaDoc for Buddy, TaskList, and Storage
- Add method-level JavaDoc for key public methods
- Document constructors and their parameters
- Provide clear descriptions of class responsibilities

- Add constants for magic strings in Storage class
- Use meaningful constant names for task delimiters and status markers
- Improve code readability with proper line breaks
- Follow SE-EDU naming conventions for constants
Add JavaDoc documentation to main classes
Improve coding standards compliance
Add find command functionality for task search

- Add JavaFX plugin and dependencies to build.gradle
- Create Launcher class to avoid module path issues
- Create MainApp class with GUI layout
- Create DialogBox class for chat interface
- Add GUI methods to Buddy class (initializeWithGui, getWelcomeMessage, getResponse)
- Update application mainClass to use Launcher

commitResults.messageTitle: A-CheckStyle: Add CheckStyle for coding standard violations
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add CheckStyle plugin to build.gradle
- Create checkstyle.xml configuration with Java coding standards
- CheckStyle successfully detects 163 violations across 14 files
- Run './gradlew checkstyleMain' to check coding standards

- Convert showFoundTasks(Task[] foundTasks) to showFoundTasks(Task... foundTasks)
- Add new showMessages(String... messages) method that uses varargs
- Demonstrates variable-length parameter lists in Java

This increment adds assert statements to validate important
assumptions throughout the codebase:

- Parser methods now assert input parameters are not null
- Task constructor validates description and type are not null/empty
- TaskList operations include assertions for data integrity

The assertions help catch programming errors early during
development and serve as documentation of expected conditions.

commitResults.messageTitle: A-CodeQuality: Refactor code to improve quality and maintainability
commitResults.messageBody:
This increment addresses multiple code quality issues identified
during analysis:

• Eliminated magic numbers by introducing named constants
• Reduced code duplication between CLI and GUI command processing
• Extracted reusable processCommand method to centralize logic
• Improved performance in array conversions and string operations
• Added meaningful constant names for better code readability

These changes follow established coding standards and improve
the overall maintainability of the codebase while preserving
all existing functionality.

commitResults.messageTitle: A-Streams: Implement Java Stream API for enhanced data processing
commitResults.messageBody:
This increment introduces Java Streams to replace traditional
loop-based operations with more functional programming approaches:

• TaskList.findTasks() now uses stream filtering with lambdas
• Added stream-based methods for task statistics and queries
• Replaced manual iteration with IntStream for list formatting
• Utilized method references and lambda expressions appropriately

The implementation maintains backward compatibility while
providing cleaner, more expressive code that leverages
modern Java features for better readability and performance.

This extension adds comprehensive task sorting capabilities
to enhance task management workflows:

• Added three sorting methods: by description, status, and type
• Implemented sort command with user-friendly syntax
• Integrated sorting with both CLI and GUI interfaces
• Maintains task persistence after sorting operations

The sorting feature allows users to organize their tasks
more effectively, with incomplete tasks prioritized in
status sorting and alphabetical fallback for consistency.

Users can now use commands like:
- sort description
- sort status
- sort type

Merge pull request from branch-A-Assertions to master.
Adds Java assert statements throughout the codebase for better
error detection and code documentation.

Resolved conflicts by combining:
- Constants from A-CodeQuality for better maintainability
- Assertions from A-Assertions for better error detection

Both improvements are now integrated in the branch.

Merge pull request from branch-A-CodeQuality to master.
Improves code quality with constants, reduced duplication,
and better maintainability while preserving assertions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch-A-Streams with streams implementation and additional utility methods
Add A-AiAssisted: Document AI tool usage in development
Add A-BetterGui: Enhanced UI with modern design and responsive layout
commitResults.messageBody:
- Improved asymmetric chat design with distinct user/bot styling
- Added error message highlighting with red styling
- Enhanced visual design with modern colors and rounded bubbles
- Enabled window resizing with responsive layout
- Added hover effects and improved typography
- Created placeholder system for profile pictures

commitResults.messageTitle: Add A-Personality: Transform Buddy into an enthusiastic productivity companion
commitResults.messageBody:
- Changed name from Duke to Buddy with energetic personality
- Added emojis and motivational language throughout responses
- Updated window title to reflect enthusiastic nature
- Enhanced all user interactions with positive, encouraging tone
- Made error messages more friendly and helpful
- Transformed task management into a gamified experience

commitResults.messageTitle: Add A-MoreErrorHandling: Comprehensive error handling with helpful messages
commitResults.messageBody:
- Enhanced Parser with detailed error validation and friendly messages
- Added input length validation and boundary checking
- Improved task index validation with contextual error messages
- Added support for edge cases like empty input, invalid numbers, etc.
- Enhanced user experience with specific suggestions for each error type
- Added comprehensive error catching in main application flow

commitResults.messageTitle: Finalize iP: Add comprehensive user guide and product website
commitResults.messageBody:
- Created detailed user guide with all features and examples
- Added product screenshot (Ui.png) showing full application
- Documented all commands with expected outputs
- Added tips, error handling info, and technical notes
- Generated production-ready JAR file
- Cleaned up temporary files
